After the quality assurance team has passed the completed solution, the business analyst should conduct user acceptance testing.

User acceptance testing (UAT) is a type of testing that is conducted to ensure that a solution meets the requirements and expectations of the end users. It involves having the end users test the solution and provide feedback on its functionality, usability, and overall performance.

In this case, the business analyst should coordinate user acceptance testing to ensure that the solution meets the needs of the end users and is ready for deployment. This may involve working with the end users to develop test cases, coordinating the testing process, and gathering and analyzing feedback from the end users.

Which of the following techniques contrasts the current and desired business views to analyze possible business changes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A gap analysis is a process that businesses use to compare their current performance to their desired performance. The purpose of a gap analysis is to: 
Determine if a company is meeting expectations and using its resources effectively
Identify any gaps or shortcomings that a business might have
Create a strategy to overcome any issues and improve business operations
Determine what steps should be taken to meet business requirements or objectives
The answer seems C because gap analysis is the technique that works on finding the difference between the current and the desired state.
